Post-Match Reflections: Rocco Baldelli said he will 'take the criticism' on disappointing 2024 finish.
Baldelli emphasized that he is 'never stressed out' about his job security.
Baldelli acknowledged the right of dissatisfied fans to express their emotions toward him.
Baldelli spoke of trying everything he could think of down the stretch as his team floundered.
Baldelli noted that he still has the same drive to manage this team and is already in the process of thinking about how the mistakes of 2024 might never be repeated.
Carlos Correa acknowledged there will 'be a lot of changes' during the offseason.
Several players within Baldelli's clubhouse asserted that the players themselves deserved the blame for the collapse.
Bailey Ober said it would be unfair for Baldelli to take the fall on their behalf.
Ryan Jeffers noted that the team showed glimpses of being a really good baseball team, but couldn't be consistent.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Twins collapsed 12-26 since mid-August, dropping them from a seemingly comfortable playoff spot to eliminated.
The team's 9-2 loss to the Orioles on Saturday extended the collapse.
The Twins can't simply run it back with the same group, and there will be a lot of changes during the offseason.
The team fell a whisker shy of the playoffs regardless, and key injuries were cited as things that steered their season off course.
